p: Water distilled oil obtained from the aerial parts of T. persicum, which is endemic to Iran, have been the subject of our previous studies. epi- α-Cadinol (23.2%) and α-pinene (17.3%) were the main components among the thirty-one constituents characterized in the oil of T. persicum representing 95.9% of the total components detected ( 55). The oil of T. gnaphalodes was characterized by higher amounts or β-caryophyllene (12.1%), sabinene (8.8%) and trans- pinocarveol (7.8%) ( 53).
